column5: Was talking to a friend that said he fished there back in the 80s. Just wondering how the fishing was now a days. If anyone is familiar with it. Thanks
This is one real beauty of a lake. The Bass fishing is excellent. I have fished many tourneys there over the years. Walleye fishing is ok as well

If you want some great Polish food while your there Tom, take hwy 60 a couple miles east of Barry's Bay and go to the Wilno Tavern and you'll be very happy you did. It's 100 miles from my house but my wife and I head there a couple times a year for lunch.

Spent entire summers there (Polish family).  Lew's right about Wilno Tavern...check it out. Kaminiskeg is a great bass fishery.  We also did well with lakers down rigging gang trolls with a minnow threaded on the end.
I haven't been to Barry's Bay in over 50 years but what I do remember is that every business seemed to be owned by some one with the name Yakabuski ?
